questions.question: This time tomorrow, I ............................... on the beach.
questions.description: To say that an activity will be in progress at a particular time in the future, we use the future continuous tense.

questions.question: She said that she ....................... help me.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.

questions.question: Phone me when you ............................ time.
questions.description: In many subordinate clauses we use the present tenses to refer to the future.

questions.question: I will follow you wherever you ...........................
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the future tense, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to future.

questions.question: You ........................... an accident if you go on driving like that.
questions.description: In conditional sentences, when the verb in the if-clause is in the simple present tense, we use will + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: When you phoned, I ................................. in the garage.
questions.description: We use the past continuous to talk about a past event that was going on a particular time in the past.

questions.question: I .............................. all my childhood in South India.
questions.description: The simple past is the normal tense for talking about the past. We use it when we don't have a special reason to use another tense.

questions.question: The phone ......................... while I was having a bath.
questions.description: We use the simple past to refer to shorter actions that happen in the middle of a longer action.

questions.question: I tried a little of the soup to see how it ..........................
questions.description: Some verbs are not normally used in the continuous form. Taste is one of them.

questions.question: When we were children we ............................. our own toys.
questions.description: We use the simple past to talk about habitual past actions.

questions.question: I can't dance because I ........................... my leg.
questions.description: The present tense is used to say that a finished action is connected with the present in some way.

questions.question: I .......................... the bell six times but no one opened the door.
questions.description: We use the simple past to talk about repeated past actions.
